title: Fears for 13-year-old boy who vanished after going to meet friend at the seaside
text:
Police are concerned for the welfare of missing Patrick Casey (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Police have released an urgent appeal for help to find a 13-year-old boy who went missing after going to meet a friend over a week ago. 
Patrick Casey, 13, was last seen at home on Saturday March 18 before heading off to meet his pal in Clacton, Essex. 
But after not returning home, officers believe friends are "enabling him to remain missing". 
Essex Police today took to Facebook to thank people for sharing their original appeal, which has so far reached more than 1.5 million people. Patrick was going to see a friend in Clacton (generic picture) (Photo: Christine Matthews/Creative Commons) Read More Four-year-old girl found walking her Staffordshire bull terrier dog alone in street wearing just her pyjamas 
Chief Insp Russ Cole, district commander for Tendring wrote: “I am extremely grateful to every single person who has taken the time to share our appeal for information about Patrick’s whereabouts. 
“There is an awful lot of work ongoing by my officers to develop a number of lines of enquiry to find Patrick. 
“I think he is possibly with a group of friends who are supporting him and enabling him to remain missing. I know these people are likely to be using social media and therefore I ask you to continue sharing the appeal so it reaches those who need to see it. 
“I also have a message for Patrick. We have been working for more than a week now to find you and make sure you are safe. A considerable number of police officers have been dedicated to looking for you. Please get in touch with us and let us know you are ok.” 
There are concerns for Patrick who is missing from the Frinton area of Essex. 
He is described as being 5ft 2ins and of a slim build. Read More 
He was last seen wearing a blue Nike baseball cap, a grey top and grey bottoms and was carrying an Adidas bag. 
Anyone who knows where he is or has seen him can contact police on 101. Like us on Facebook
